text: blanketed in jungle fringed by beaches
bugera island is the biggest in uganda
Sesay archipelago in Lake Victoria for
Ugandan za used to be a shorthand for
remoteness today Bogle has abundant
forests and thriving waters are drawing
people to its glittering Shore
you'd be forgiven for thinking that
we're in the middle of an ocean and it's
the sheer size of this lake that makes
the island so remote but it is also what
has sustained the people of bugera in
the forests there is life on every
branch and an income in each tree trunk
Jude Kagame became a boat builder to put
himself through school to build I used
for transporting people food and animals
and for fishing some of the wood we get
from here on the island and some comes
from Congo the trees we use are getting
more and more scarce which is why we
look to other countries much of the
forest has been cut down for palm trees
palm oil is in demand around the world
growing it can bring wealth but it comes
at a cost
precise rows of palm encroach on what
was once wild jungle and it's not just
the landscape Islanders livelihoods are
visibly changing it tells me no more
than cars on the island now and you'd
need one to traverse the new roads which
carved through the island but look
around and it's a world of water every
morning fishing boats arrive at the
nakajima landing site owned and run by
the formidable mama Sylvia as a young
woman she'd fish in a small boat without
an engine
now she presides over an empire she came
to begala in the 80s and things were
different then the reason I was
attracted to this place was because
where we were the stocks had completely
vanished and this place was teeming with
fish when we came here there was no
electricity but we have started getting
piped water and the roads are being
constructed in the coming years Google
is going to be so much better than it is
now
because everything has been put in place
this community is an example of what it
means to persevere patiently to tough
times
once considered distant and mysterious
begala
is a place that a growing number of
people are now calling home the island
is bursting with potential but its
resources and infinite
for now though begala continues to hold
promise and to provide
